p: The human species used plants for treating diseases throughout history. The therapeutic properties and efficacy of each plant were mainly based on popular observations. This approach significantly contributed to their prescription, even if their chemical constituents were not always completely known [ 1, 2, 3, 4, 5]. Commercial drugs substituted medicinal plants; however, worldwide, people still use natural products for primary healthcare [ 6, 7, 8, 9, 10].
